thread.title: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS
thread.title_full: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS

author: JAY COHEN
title: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS
text:
Paul Beaty Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Chicago Cubs left fielder Kyle Schwarber celebrates in the dugout after hitting a home run against the St. Louis Cardinals during the second inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Paul Beaty) Paul Beaty Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Chicago Cubs starting pitcher Jake Arrieta (49) throws during the first inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Paul Beaty) Paul Beaty Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
St. Louis Cardinals starting pitcher Michael Wacha (52) throws during the first inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series against the Chicago Cubs, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Paul Beaty) Nam Y. Huh Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
A fan hold up a sign outside of Wrigley Field before Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series between the Chicago Cubs and the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Charles Rex Arbogast Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Fans observe during the national anthem before Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series between the Chicago Cubs and the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Nam Y. Huh Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Chicago Cubs' Miguel Montero (47), Kris Bryant, Anthony Rizzo (44) and Starlin Castro (13) gather around starting pitcher Jake Arrieta (49) during the fourth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Nam Y. Huh Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS 
Chicago Cubs' Jorge Soler (68) hits a home run against the St. Louis Cardinals during the sixth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Posted: Monday, October 12, 2015 6:49 pm Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals 8-6 for 2-1 lead in NLDS Associated Press | 
CHICAGO (AP) â€” Kris Bryant and Jorge Soler each hit two-run drives and the Chicago Cubs connected for a postseason franchise-record six homers in an 8-6 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals in Game 3 of the NL Division Series on Monday. 
Kyle Schwarber, Anthony Rizzo, Starlin Castro and Dexter Fowler also homered, powering Jake Arrieta to another win despite a rare off night for the bearded ace. The Cubs' previous record for most homers in a playoff game was five in the opener of the 1984 NL Championship Series against San Diego.
